intro: Topobea latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf topobea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. Botanically, it belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton.
